intro: Rogiera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Rogiera species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
